02319-d-09-26-02-URR.Narrative: CREW HAD PREVIOUSLY PLACED SIX CARS ON THE HILL TRACK.  CREW WENT TO DINNER.  WHEN CREW CAME OUT OFDINNER, BRAKEMAN WAS ON HEADEND.  CONDUCTOR AND ENGINEER IN CAB OF LOCOMOTIVE.  ENGINEER RECEIVED HAND SIGNAL FROM HEADMAN TO PROCEED.  THEY MOVED LITE LOCOMOTIVE SOUTH.  ALL CREW MEMBERS FAILED TO REMEMBER THEY PREVIOUSLY LEFT CARS ON HILL TRACK AND PROCEEDED SOUTH ON SAME TRACK.  WEATHER WAS RAINYAND DARK.  WHEN THE HEADMAN NOTICED CARS ON TRACK, HE GAVE A STEADY SIGN, ENGINEER DID NOT SEE THEHAND SIGNAL,(HEADMAN DID NOT USE HIS LANTERN).  HEADMAN THEN USED RADIO TO INSTRUCT LOCOMOTIVE TO STOP  AND DISMOUNTED LOCOMOTIVE.  ENGINEER ATTEMPTED TO STOP LITE LOCOMOTIVE AFTER RECEIVING RADIO SIGNAL TO STOP, BUT LOCOMOTIVE IMPACTED WITH CARS ON HILL TRACK BEFORE STOPPING.  DAMAGE TO COUPLER ANDCOUPLER POCKET OF LOCOMOTIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

206-d-09-09-02-FGLK.Accident Cause: Broken Rail - Vertical split head   [Desc.Changed-Refer to Current/Prev.Guides]
206-d-09-09-02-FGLK.Narrative: TRAIN GW2 (GENEVA TO WATINS - ROUND TRIP).  CREW:  ENGINEER ON DUTY AT 0800 AND CONDUCTOR ON DUTY AT0800.  SWITCHED WATKINS GLEN SALT PLANTS.  CREW HAD FORM D TO OPERATE ON FINGER LAKES TRACKAGE.  ONNORTHBOUND TRIP CREW RECEIVED FORM D TO OPERATE ON NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORNING SECONDARY TRACK FROM HIMROD TO GENEVA.  ENGINES 2004 AND 2301 WITH A CONSIST OF 29 LOADS, THREE EMPTY CARS.  NO HAZARDOUS CARS PROCEEDED NORTH ON THE CONNECTION TO ROD SIDING.  THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY, CREW CALLED TRAINMASTER/DISPATCHER TO REPORT DERAILMENT AT 17:15.  EMERGENCY SERVICES, POLICE, NYS DOT, NORFOLK SOUTHERN DISPATCHER, FRA OP WERE NOTIFIED.  FGLK TRAINMASTER RESPONDED TO THE SCENE, FOUND SEVEN CARS DERAILED - ALL LOADS, ONE BOX CAR (UPRIGHT), FOUR CLSX COVERED HOPPERS (ON SIDE), AND TWO GNWR HOPPERS (UPRIGHT).  INVESTIGATION BY TRACK SUPERINTENDENT, NS TRAINMASTER, FGLK MECHANICAL SUPERVISOR ANDFGLK TRAINMASTER.  DETERMINED THAT THE LEAD TWO LOCOMOTIVES AND TEN CARS HAD CROSSED OVER THE TRACKAND A SECTION ABOUT 5 INCHES LONG OF RAIL HEAD ON THE GAUGE SIDE HAD SHATTERED AND COLLAPSED DERAILING CARS #11 TO #17 BEFORE THE TRAIN WAS STOPPED DUE TO AN EMERGENCY APPLICATION OF THE BRAKE SYSTEM.NEARBY GRADE CROSSING WAS CLEARED BY ROLLING CARS BACK FROM CROSSING AND WINTERS DERAILMENT CONTRACTORS WERE CALLED TO CLEAR THE SCENE.  NO DRUG OR ALCOHOL INVOLVEMENT, AND NO TESTING DONE.  NO LEAKAGE OF ANY FUEL OR HAZARDOUS MATERIALS, HOWEVER, SALT LEAKED FROM OVERTURNED HOPPERS.
